page.title: Adverbs and AdvP - Locative Adverbs
page.introduction:
Locative adverbs include the English words: here, there, everywhere. These locative adverbs may be related to the demonstratives. Many languages also have a negative temporal adverb meaning nowhere.
In English, location is often also expressed by a prepositional phrase, such as: in the mountains, at San Jose, over there. Many languages allow just a nominal phrase, consisting of a proper noun or description of the place.
We will begin again with the positive locative adverbs. Think about how locatives are expressed in your language. For those which are adverbs, are there any degree words which can modify them? In English, this seems to be limited to only (a type of focus construction) and right, as in:

radioGroup.radio: No, these elements are not marked with classifiers
Yes, these elements are marked with classifiers as part of the concord agreement system

radioGroup.radio: No, the forms are completely distinct

radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have any degree words which modify the locative adverbs?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, a degree word many appear before the locative adverb

No, but reduplication is used to intensify the meaning of the locative adverb
No, locative adverbs are not modified or intensified

radioGroup.prompt: Moving now to the negatives, does your language have any negative locative adverbs which are separate words?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, a separate word or phrase unrelated to the positive forms expresses the negative locative concept of ‘no place’

form.instruction: In the lexicon, key the feature locative on all adverbs that express location. You can also add this feature to nouns and proper names which express location.
In the lexicon, you will need to have two entries for each word, one with the category Adv and feature locative and one with the category Dem.
In the lexicon, key the features locative makeAdv on the affix that is added to a demonstrative to form a locative adverb, as this will take care of the category change needed.
In the lexicon, key the features negative locative on all the negative locative adverbs.
In the lexicon, key the feature negative on the negative affix(es) that attach to a locative adverb to express the meaning of ‘nowhere’.
In the lexicon, key the feature negative locative on the affix(es) that express the meaning of ‘nowhere’.
